fields.value: Washington Post Virginia Governor Poll, October 1997

dsDescriptionValue.value:
This special topic poll sought the views of Virginia residents on
the November 1997 gubernatorial election. Respondents were asked  to give their opinions of gubernatorial candidates James S. Gilmore   (Republican)   and Donald S. Beyer (Democrat), lieutenant governor candidates John Hager   (Republican)  and L.F. Payne (Democrat), attorney general candidates Mark Earley (Republican)   and   William Dolan (Democrat), and incumbent governor George F. Allen. Those queried  were asked to assess the importance of the following issues: transportation  and roads, taxes, public education, the economy, crime, family values, state  spending, and abortion. Respondents were asked whether they supported  two current plans to eliminate state personal property taxes on  state vehicles and state tax credits. Additional topics included the positive   and  negative aspects of the election campaign and support for parental or spousal  consent laws on abortion. Background information on respondents includes age,   race, ethnicity,  sex, education, political party, political orientation, religion, voter  registration and participation history, marital status, family income, and age of children in household.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XIV.C.1. Mass Political Behavior and Attitudes, Public Opinion on Political Matters, United States

fields.value: Version Date: 1998-07-28Version Text: 1998-07-28Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: (1) This collection has not been processed by ICPSR  staff. ICPSR is distributing the data and documentation for this  collection in essentially the same form in which they were  received. When appropriate, hardcopy documentation has been converted  to machine-readable form and variables have been recoded to ensure  respondents' anonymity. (2) The codebook is provided as a Portable  Document Format (PDF) file. The PDF file format was developed by Adobe  Systems Incorporated and can be accessed using PDF reader software,  such as the Adobe Acrobat Reader. Information on how to obtain a copy  of the Acrobat Reader is provided through the ICPSR Website on the  Internet.(3) A weight variable with four implied decimal places has been included and must be used in any analysis.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Data file(s), and electronic documentation.;
